source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a scenic shot of a car on a paved road winding through a majestic forest of giant trees. Sunlight filters through the dense canopy, illuminating the lush greenery and the vehicle. The car is in motion, traveling along the curve of the road.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This is a scenic shot of a car on a paved road winding through a majestic forest of giant trees. Sunlight filters through the dense canopy, illuminating the lush greenery and the vehicle. The car is in motion, traveling along the curve of the road.

generated_critique: The caption is overly descriptive of the scenery and contains a subjective adjective, which violates the instructions to focus on motion and avoid emotional language. The first two sentences, "This is a scenic shot of a car on a paved road winding through a majestic forest of giant trees. Sunlight filters through the dense canopy, illuminating the lush greenery and the vehicle," should be removed. The description of the car's movement, "traveling along the curve of the road," is too generic. It should be replaced with a more specific description of the action. A better caption would be: "A car drives toward the camera, navigating a left-hand curve on a paved road through a forest."
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: A car drives toward the camera, navigating a left-hand curve on a paved road through a forest.
